segment_text: We were seated at breakfast one morning, my wife and I, when the maid brought in a telegram.
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: It was from Sherlock Holmes and ran in this way:
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: “Have you a couple of days to spare? Have just been wired for from the west of England in connection with Boscombe Valley tragedy.
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: Shall be glad if you will come with me. Air and scenery perfect.
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: Leave Paddington by the 11:15.”
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: “What do you say, dear?” said my wife, looking across at me. “Will you go?”
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: “I really don’t know what to say. I have a fairly long list at present.”
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: “Oh, Anstruther would do your work for you. You have been looking a little pale lately.
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: I think that the change would do you good, and you are always so interested in Mr. Sherlock Holmes’ cases.”
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: “I should be ungrateful if I were not, seeing what I gained through one of them,” I answered.
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: “But if I am to go, I must pack at once, for I have only half an hour.”
scene_description: indoors, breakfast table, morning light, victorian room

segment_text: My experience of camp life in Afghanistan had at least had the effect of making me a prompt and ready traveller.
scene_description: outdoors, train station platform, steam engine, morning bustle

segment_text: My wants were few and simple, so that in less than the time stated I was in a cab with my valise, rattling away to Paddington Station.
scene_description: outdoors, train station platform, steam engine, morning bustle

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes was pacing up and down the platform, his tall, gaunt figure made even gaunter and taller by his long grey travelling-cloak and close-fitting cloth cap.
scene_description: outdoors, train station platform, steam engine, morning bustle

segment_text: “It is really very good of you to come, Watson,” said he.
scene_description: outdoors, train station platform, steam engine, morning bustle

segment_text: “It makes a considerable difference to me, having someone with me on whom I can thoroughly rely. Local aid is always either worthless or else biassed.
scene_description: outdoors, train station platform, steam engine, morning bustle

segment_text: If you will keep the two corner seats I shall get the tickets.”
scene_description: outdoors, train station platform, steam engine, morning bustle

segment_text: We had the carriage to ourselves save for an immense litter of papers which Holmes had brought with him.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Among these he rummaged and read, with intervals of note-taking and of meditation, until we were past Reading.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Then he suddenly rolled them all into a gigantic ball and tossed them up onto the rack.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Have you heard anything of the case?” he asked.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Not a word. I have not seen a paper for some days.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The London press has not had very full accounts. I have just been looking through all the recent papers in order to master the particulars.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: It seems, from what I gather, to be one of those simple cases which are so extremely difficult.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “That sounds a little paradoxical.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “But it is profoundly true. Singularity is almost invariably a clue.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The more featureless and commonplace a crime is, the more difficult it is to bring it home.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: In this case, however, they have established a very serious case against the son of the murdered man.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “It is a murder, then?”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Well, it is conjectured to be so. I shall take nothing for granted until I have the opportunity of looking personally into it.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I will explain the state of things to you, as far as I have been able to understand it, in a very few words.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Boscombe Valley is a country district not very far from Ross, in Herefordshire.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The largest landed proprietor in that part is a Mr. John Turner, who made his money in Australia and returned some years ago to the old country.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: One of the farms which he held, that of Hatherley, was let to Mr. Charles McCarthy, who was also an ex-Australian.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The men had known each other in the colonies, so that it was not unnatural that when they came to settle down they should do so as near each other as possible.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Turner was apparently the richer man, so McCarthy became his tenant but still remained, it seems, upon terms of perfect equality, as they were frequently together.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: McCarthy had one son, a lad of eighteen, and Turner had an only daughter of the same age, but neither of them had wives living.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: They appear to have avoided the society of the neighbouring English families and to have led retired lives, though both the McCarthys were fond of sport and were frequently seen at the race-meetings of the neighbourhood.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: McCarthy kept two servants—a man and a girl. Turner had a considerable household, some half-dozen at the least.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: That is as much as I have been able to gather about the families. Now for the facts.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “On June 3rd, that is, on Monday last, McCarthy left his house at Hatherley about three in the afternoon and walked down to the Boscombe Pool, which is a small lake formed by the spreading out of the stream which runs down the Boscombe Valley.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: He had been out with his serving-man in the morning at Ross, and he had told the man that he must hurry, as he had an appointment of importance to keep at three.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: From that appointment he never came back alive.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “From Hatherley Farmhouse to the Boscombe Pool is a quarter of a mile, and two people saw him as he passed over this ground.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: One was an old woman, whose name is not mentioned, and the other was William Crowder, a game-keeper in the employ of Mr. Turner.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Both these witnesses depose that Mr. McCarthy was walking alone.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The game-keeper adds that within a few minutes of his seeing Mr. McCarthy pass he had seen his son, Mr. James McCarthy, going the same way with a gun under his arm.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: To the best of his belief, the father was actually in sight at the time, and the son was following him.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: He thought no more of the matter until he heard in the evening of the tragedy that had occurred.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The two McCarthys were seen after the time when William Crowder, the game-keeper, lost sight of them.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The Boscombe Pool is thickly wooded round, with just a fringe of grass and of reeds round the edge.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: A girl of fourteen, Patience Moran, who is the daughter of the lodge-keeper of the Boscombe Valley estate, was in one of the woods picking flowers.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: She states that while she was there she saw, at the border of the wood and close by the lake, Mr. McCarthy and his son, and that they appeared to be having a violent quarrel.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: She heard Mr. McCarthy the elder using very strong language to his son, and she saw the latter raise up his hand as if to strike his father.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: She was so frightened by their violence that she ran away and told her mother when she reached home that she had left the two McCarthys quarrelling near Boscombe Pool, and that she was afraid that they were going to fight.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: She had hardly said the words when young Mr. McCarthy came running up to the lodge to say that he had found his father dead in the wood, and to ask for the help of the lodge-keeper.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: He was much excited, without either his gun or his hat, and his right hand and sleeve were observed to be stained with fresh blood.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: On following him they found the dead body stretched out upon the grass beside the pool.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The head had been beaten in by repeated blows of some heavy and blunt weapon.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The injuries were such as might very well have been inflicted by the butt-end of his son’s gun, which was found lying on the grass within a few paces of the body.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Under these circumstances the young man was instantly arrested, and a verdict of ‘wilful murder’ having been returned at the inquest on Tuesday, he was on Wednesday brought before the magistrates at Ross, who have referred the case to the next Assizes.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Those are the main facts of the case as they came out before the coroner and the police-court.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “I could hardly imagine a more damning case,” I remarked. “If ever circumstantial evidence pointed to a criminal it does so here.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Circumstantial evidence is a very tricky thing,” answered Holmes thoughtfully.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “It may seem to point very straight to one thing, but if you shift your own point of view a little, you may find it pointing in an equally uncompromising manner to something entirely different.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: It must be confessed, however, that the case looks exceedingly grave against the young man, and it is very possible that he is indeed the culprit.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: There are several people in the neighbourhood, however, and among them Miss Turner, the daughter of the neighbouring landowner, who believe in his innocence, and who have retained Lestrade, whom you may recollect in connection with the Study in Scarlet, to work out the case in his interest.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Lestrade, being rather puzzled, has referred the case to me, and hence it is that two middle-aged gentlemen are flying westward at fifty miles an hour instead of quietly digesting their breakfasts at home.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “I am afraid,” said I, “that the facts are so obvious that you will find little credit to be gained out of this case.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact,” he answered, laughing.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Besides, we may chance to hit upon some other obvious facts which may have been by no means obvious to Mr. Lestrade.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: You know me too well to think that I am boasting when I say that I shall either confirm or destroy his theory by means which he is quite incapable of employing, or even of understanding.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: To take the first example to hand, I very clearly perceive that in your bedroom the window is upon the right-hand side, and yet I question whether Mr. Lestrade would have noted even so self-evident a thing as that.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “How on earth—”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “My dear fellow, I know you well. I know the military neatness which characterises you.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: You shave every morning, and in this season you shave by the sunlight; but since your shaving is less and less complete as we get farther back on the left side, until it becomes positively slovenly as we get round the angle of the jaw, it is surely very clear that that side is less illuminated than the other.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I could not imagine a man of your habits looking at himself in an equal light and being satisfied with such a result.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I only quote this as a trivial example of observation and inference. Therein lies my _métier_, and it is just possible that it may be of some service in the investigation which lies before us.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: There are one or two minor points which were brought out in the inquest, and which are worth considering.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “What are they?”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “It appears that his arrest did not take place at once, but after the return to Hatherley Farm.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: On the inspector of constabulary informing him that he was a prisoner, he remarked that he was not surprised to hear it, and that it was no more than his deserts.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: This observation of his had the natural effect of removing any traces of doubt which might have remained in the minds of the coroner’s jury.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “It was a confession,” I ejaculated.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “No, for it was followed by a protestation of innocence.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Coming on the top of such a damning series of events, it was at least a most suspicious remark.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “On the contrary,” said Holmes, “it is the brightest rift which I can at present see in the clouds.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: However innocent he might be, he could not be such an absolute imbecile as not to see that the circumstances were very black against him.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Had he appeared surprised at his own arrest, or feigned indignation at it, I should have looked upon it as highly suspicious, because such surprise or anger would not be natural under the circumstances, and yet might appear to be the best policy to a scheming man.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: His frank acceptance of the situation marks him as either an innocent man, or else as a man of considerable self-restraint and firmness.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: As to his remark about his deserts, it was also not unnatural if you consider that he stood beside the dead body of his father, and that there is no doubt that he had that very day so far forgotten his filial duty as to bandy words with him, and even, according to the little girl whose evidence is so important, to raise his hand as if to strike him.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: The self-reproach and contrition which are displayed in his remark appear to me to be the signs of a healthy mind rather than of a guilty one.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I shook my head. “Many men have been hanged on far slighter evidence,” I remarked.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “So they have. And many men have been wrongfully hanged.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “What is the young man’s own account of the matter?”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “It is, I am afraid, not very encouraging to his supporters, though there are one or two points in it which are suggestive.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: You will find it here, and may read it for yourself.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: He picked out from his bundle a copy of the local Herefordshire paper, and having turned down the sheet he pointed out the paragraph in which the unfortunate young man had given his own statement of what had occurred.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I settled myself down in the corner of the carriage and read it very carefully. It ran in this way:
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Mr. James McCarthy, the only son of the deceased, was then called and gave evidence as follows: ‘I had been away from home for three days at Bristol, and had only just returned upon the morning of last Monday, the 3rd.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: My father was absent from home at the time of my arrival, and I was informed by the maid that he had driven over to Ross with John Cobb, the groom.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Shortly after my return I heard the wheels of his trap in the yard, and, looking out of my window, I saw him get out and walk rapidly out of the yard, though I was not aware in which direction he was going.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I then took my gun and strolled out in the direction of the Boscombe Pool, with the intention of visiting the rabbit warren which is upon the other side.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: On my way I saw William Crowder, the game-keeper, as he had stated in his evidence; but he is mistaken in thinking that I was following my father.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I had no idea that he was in front of me. When about a hundred yards from the pool I heard a cry of “Cooee!” which was a usual signal between my father and myself.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I then hurried forward, and found him standing by the pool. He appeared to be much surprised at seeing me and asked me rather roughly what I was doing there.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: A conversation ensued which led to high words and almost to blows, for my father was a man of a very violent temper.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Seeing that his passion was becoming ungovernable, I left him and returned towards Hatherley Farm.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I had not gone more than 150 yards, however, when I heard a hideous outcry behind me, which caused me to run back again.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I found my father expiring upon the ground, with his head terribly injured. I dropped my gun and held him in my arms, but he almost instantly expired.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I knelt beside him for some minutes, and then made my way to Mr. Turner’s lodge-keeper, his house being the nearest, to ask for assistance.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: I saw no one near my father when I returned, and I have no idea how he came by his injuries.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: He was not a popular man, being somewhat cold and forbidding in his manners, but he had, as far as I know, no active enemies. I know nothing further of the matter.’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: Did your father make any statement to you before he died?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: He mumbled a few words, but I could only catch some allusion to a rat.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: What did you understand by that?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: It conveyed no meaning to me. I thought that he was delirious.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: What was the point upon which you and your father had this final quarrel?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: I should prefer not to answer.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: I am afraid that I must press it.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: It is really impossible for me to tell you. I can assure you that it has nothing to do with the sad tragedy which followed.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: That is for the court to decide. I need not point out to you that your refusal to answer will prejudice your case considerably in any future proceedings which may arise.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: I must still refuse.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: I understand that the cry of ‘Cooee’ was a common signal between you and your father?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: It was.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: How was it, then, that he uttered it before he saw you, and before he even knew that you had returned from Bristol?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness (with considerable confusion): I do not know.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “A Juryman: Did you see nothing which aroused your suspicions when you returned on hearing the cry and found your father fatally injured?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: Nothing definite.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “The Coroner: What do you mean?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Witness: I was so disturbed and excited as I rushed out into the open, that I could think of nothing except of my father.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Yet I have a vague impression that as I ran forward something lay upon the ground to the left of me.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: It seemed to me to be something grey in colour, a coat of some sort, or a plaid perhaps. When I rose from my father I looked round for it, but it was gone.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘Do you mean that it disappeared before you went for help?’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘Yes, it was gone.’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘You cannot say what it was?’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘No, I had a feeling something was there.’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘How far from the body?’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘A dozen yards or so.’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘And how far from the edge of the wood?’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘About the same.’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘Then if it was removed it was while you were within a dozen yards of it?’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “‘Yes, but with my back towards it.’
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “This concluded the examination of the witness.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “I see,” said I as I glanced down the column, “that the coroner in his concluding remarks was rather severe upon young McCarthy.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: He calls attention, and with reason, to the discrepancy about his father having signalled to him before seeing him, also to his refusal to give details of his conversation with his father, and his singular account of his father’s dying words.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: They are all, as he remarks, very much against the son.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Holmes laughed softly to himself and stretched himself out upon the cushioned seat.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: “Both you and the coroner have been at some pains,” said he, “to single out the very strongest points in the young man’s favour.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Don’t you see that you alternately give him credit for having too much imagination and too little?
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: Too little, if he could not invent a cause of quarrel which would give him the sympathy of the jury; too much, if he evolved from his own inner consciousness anything so _outré_ as a dying reference to a rat, and the incident of the vanishing cloth.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: No, sir, I shall approach this case from the point of view that what this young man says is true, and we shall see whither that hypothesis will lead us.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: And now here is my pocket Petrarch, and not another word shall I say of this case until we are on the scene of action.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: We lunch at Swindon, and I see that we shall be there in twenty minutes.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage, plush seats, countryside views

segment_text: It was nearly four o’clock when we at last, after passing through the beautiful Stroud Valley, and over the broad gleaming Severn, found ourselves at the pretty little country-town of Ross.
scene_description: outdoors, rural train station, platform, afternoon light

segment_text: A lean, ferret-like man, furtive and sly-looking, was waiting for us upon the platform.
scene_description: outdoors, rural train station, platform, afternoon light

segment_text: In spite of the light brown dustcoat and leather-leggings which he wore in deference to his rustic surroundings, I had no difficulty in recognising Lestrade, of Scotland Yard.
scene_description: outdoors, rural train station, platform, afternoon light

segment_text: With him we drove to the Hereford Arms where a room had already been engaged for us.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “I have ordered a carriage,” said Lestrade as we sat over a cup of tea.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “I knew your energetic nature, and that you would not be happy until you had been on the scene of the crime.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “It was very nice and complimentary of you,” Holmes answered. “It is entirely a question of barometric pressure.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Lestrade looked startled. “I do not quite follow,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “How is the glass? Twenty-nine, I see. No wind, and not a cloud in the sky.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I have a caseful of cigarettes here which need smoking, and the sofa is very much superior to the usual country hotel abomination.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I do not think that it is probable that I shall use the carriage to-night.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Lestrade laughed indulgently. “You have, no doubt, already formed your conclusions from the newspapers,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Who was the criminal, then?” “The gentleman I describe.” “But who is he?”
scene_description: outdoors, town street, victorian building facade, evening light

segment_text: “Surely it would not be difficult to find out. This is not such a populous neighbourhood.” Lestrade shrugged his shoulders.
scene_description: outdoors, town street, victorian building facade, evening light

segment_text: “I am a practical man,” he said, “and I really cannot undertake to go about the country looking for a left-handed gentleman with a game leg. I should become the laughing-stock of Scotland Yard.”
scene_description: outdoors, town street, victorian building facade, evening light

segment_text: “All right,” said Holmes quietly. “I have given you the chance. Here are your lodgings. Good-bye. I shall drop you a line before I leave.”
scene_description: outdoors, town street, victorian building facade, evening light

segment_text: Having left Lestrade at his rooms, we drove to our hotel, where we found lunch upon the table.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Holmes was silent and buried in thought with a pained expression upon his face, as one who finds himself in a perplexing position.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Look here, Watson,” he said when the cloth was cleared “just sit down in this chair and let me preach to you for a little.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I don’t know quite what to do, and I should value your advice. Light a cigar and let me expound.” “Pray do so.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Well, now, in considering this case there are two points about young McCarthy’s narrative which struck us both instantly, although they impressed me in his favour and you against him.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: One was the fact that his father should, according to his account, cry ‘Cooee!’ before seeing him. The other was his singular dying reference to a rat.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: He mumbled several words, you understand, but that was all that caught the son’s ear. Now from this double point our research must commence, and we will begin it by presuming that what the lad says is absolutely true.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “What of this ‘Cooee!’ then?” “Well, obviously it could not have been meant for the son. The son, as far as he knew, was in Bristol.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: It was mere chance that he was within earshot. The ‘Cooee!’ was meant to attract the attention of whoever it was that he had the appointment with.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: But ‘Cooee’ is a distinctly Australian cry, and one which is used between Australians. There is a strong presumption that the person whom McCarthy expected to meet him at Boscombe Pool was someone who had been in Australia.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “What of the rat, then?” Sherlock Holmes took a folded paper from his pocket and flattened it out on the table.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “This is a map of the Colony of Victoria,” he said. “I wired to Bristol for it last night.” He put his hand over part of the map.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “What do you read?” “ARAT,” I read. “And now?” He raised his hand. “BALLARAT.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Quite so. That was the word the man uttered, and of which his son only caught the last two syllables. He was trying to utter the name of his murderer. So and so, of Ballarat.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “It is wonderful!” I exclaimed. “It is obvious. And now, you see, I had narrowed the field down considerably.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: The possession of a grey garment was a third point which, granting the son’s statement to be correct, was a certainty. We have come now out of mere vagueness to the definite conception of an Australian from Ballarat with a grey cloak.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Certainly.” “And one who was at home in the district, for the pool can only be approached by the farm or by the estate, where strangers could hardly wander.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Quite so.” “Then comes our expedition of to-day. By an examination of the ground I gained the trifling details which I gave to that imbecile Lestrade, as to the personality of the criminal.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “But how did you gain them?” “You know my method. It is founded upon the observation of trifles.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “His height I know that you might roughly judge from the length of his stride. His boots, too, might be told from their traces.” “Yes, they were peculiar boots.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “But his lameness?” “The impression of his right foot was always less distinct than his left. He put less weight upon it. Why? Because he limped—he was lame.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “But his left-handedness.” “You were yourself struck by the nature of the injury as recorded by the surgeon at the inquest. The blow was struck from immediately behind, and yet was upon the left side.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Now, how can that be unless it were by a left-handed man? He had stood behind that tree during the interview between the father and son. He had even smoked there.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I found the ash of a cigar, which my special knowledge of tobacco ashes enables me to pronounce as an Indian cigar. I have, as you know, devoted some attention to this, and written a little monograph on the ashes of 140 different varieties of pipe, cigar, and cigarette tobacco.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Having found the ash, I then looked round and discovered the stump among the moss where he had tossed it. It was an Indian cigar, of the variety which are rolled in Rotterdam.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “And the cigar-holder?” “I could see that the end had not been in his mouth. Therefore he used a holder.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: The tip had been cut off, not bitten off, but the cut was not a clean one, so I deduced a blunt pen-knife.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Holmes,” I said, “you have drawn a net round this man from which he cannot escape, and you have saved an innocent human life as truly as if you had cut the cord which was hanging him.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I see the direction in which all this points. The culprit is—” “Mr. John Turner,” cried the hotel waiter, opening the door of our sitting-room, and ushering in a visitor.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: The man who entered was a strange and impressive figure. His slow, limping step and bowed shoulders gave the appearance of decrepitude, and yet his hard, deep-lined, craggy features, and his enormous limbs showed that he was possessed of unusual strength of body and of character.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: His tangled beard, grizzled hair, and outstanding, drooping eyebrows combined to give an air of dignity and power to his appearance, but his face was of an ashen white, while his lips and the corners of his nostrils were tinged with a shade of blue.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: It was clear to me at a glance that he was in the grip of some deadly and chronic disease. “Pray sit down on the sofa,” said Holmes gently. “You had my note?”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Yes, the lodge-keeper brought it up. You said that you wished to see me here to avoid scandal.” “I thought people would talk if I went to the Hall.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “And why did you wish to see me?” He looked across at my companion with despair in his weary eyes, as though his question was already answered.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Yes,” said Holmes, answering the look rather than the words. “It is so. I know all about McCarthy.” The old man sank his face in his hands. “God help me!” he cried.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “But I would not have let the young man come to harm. I give you my word that I would have spoken out if it went against him at the Assizes.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “I am glad to hear you say so,” said Holmes gravely. “I would have spoken now had it not been for my dear girl. It would break her heart—it will break her heart when she hears that I am arrested.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “It may not come to that,” said Holmes. “What?” “I am no official agent. I understand that it was your daughter who required my presence here, and I am acting in her interests.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Young McCarthy must be got off, however.” “I am a dying man,” said old Turner. “I have had diabetes for years.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: My doctor says it is a question whether I shall live a month. Yet I would rather die under my own roof than in a gaol.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Holmes rose and sat down at the table with his pen in his hand and a bundle of paper before him. “Just tell us the truth,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “I shall jot down the facts. You will sign it, and Watson here can witness it. Then I could produce your confession at the last extremity to save young McCarthy.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I promise you that I shall not use it unless it is absolutely needed.” “It’s as well,” said the old man; “it’s a question whether I shall live to the Assizes, so it matters little to me, but I should wish to spare Alice the shock.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: And now I will make the thing clear to you; it has been a long time in the acting, but will not take me long to tell.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “You didn’t know this dead man, McCarthy. He was a devil incarnate. I tell you that. God keep you out of the clutches of such a man as he.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: His grip has been upon me these twenty years, and he has blasted my life. I’ll tell you first how I came to be in his power.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “It was in the early ’60’s at the diggings. I was a young chap then, hot-blooded and reckless, ready to turn my hand at anything; I got among bad companions, took to drink, had no luck with my claim, took to the bush, and in a word became what you would call over here a highway robber.
scene_description: outdoors, 1860s gold rush, dry earth, makeshift tents, mining equipment

segment_text: There were six of us, and we had a wild, free life of it, sticking up a station from time to time, or stopping the wagons on the road to the diggings.
scene_description: outdoors, dusty outback road, sparse bushland, distant hills, 1860s Australia

segment_text: Black Jack of Ballarat was the name I went under, and our party is still remembered in the colony as the Ballarat Gang.
scene_description: outdoors, dusty outback road, sparse bushland, distant hills, 1860s Australia

segment_text: “One day a gold convoy came down from Ballarat to Melbourne, and we lay in wait for it and attacked it. There were six troopers and six of us, so it was a close thing, but we emptied four of their saddles at the first volley.
scene_description: outdoors, dirt track, horse-drawn wagons, ambush setting, Australian bush

segment_text: Three of our boys were killed, however, before we got the swag. I put my pistol to the head of the wagon-driver, who was this very man McCarthy.
scene_description: outdoors, dirt track, horse-drawn wagons, ambush setting, Australian bush

segment_text: I wish to the Lord that I had shot him then, but I spared him, though I saw his wicked little eyes fixed on my face, as though to remember every feature.
scene_description: outdoors, dirt track, horse-drawn wagons, ambush setting, Australian bush

segment_text: We got away with the gold, became wealthy men, and made our way over to England without being suspected. There I parted from my old pals and determined to settle down to a quiet and respectable life.
scene_description: outdoors, dirt track, horse-drawn wagons, ambush setting, Australian bush

segment_text: I bought this estate, which chanced to be in the market, and I set myself to do a little good with my money, to make up for the way in which I had earned it.
scene_description: outdoors, manicured English estate, grand house exterior, peaceful gardens, daytime

segment_text: I married, too, and though my wife died young she left me my dear little Alice. Even when she was just a baby her wee hand seemed to lead me down the right path as nothing else had ever done.
scene_description: outdoors, manicured English estate, grand house exterior, peaceful gardens, daytime

segment_text: In a word, I turned over a new leaf and did my best to make up for the past. All was going well when McCarthy laid his grip upon me.
scene_description: outdoors, manicured English estate, grand house exterior, peaceful gardens, daytime

segment_text: “I had gone up to town about an investment, and I met him in Regent Street with hardly a coat to his back or a boot to his foot.
scene_description: outdoors, 19th-century London street, storefronts, cobblestone, horse-drawn traffic

segment_text: ‘Here we are, Jack,’ says he, touching me on the arm; ‘we’ll be as good as a family to you. There’s two of us, me and my son, and you can have the keeping of us.
scene_description: outdoors, 19th-century London street, storefronts, cobblestone, horse-drawn traffic

segment_text: If you don’t—it’s a fine, law-abiding country is England, and there’s always a policeman within hail.’
scene_description: outdoors, 19th-century London street, storefronts, cobblestone, horse-drawn traffic

segment_text: “Well, down they came to the west country, there was no shaking them off, and there they have lived rent free on my best land ever since.
scene_description: outdoors, English countryside, fertile farmland, distant manor, rent-free cottage

segment_text: There was no rest for me, no peace, no forgetfulness; turn where I would, there was his cunning, grinning face at my elbow.
scene_description: outdoors, English countryside, fertile farmland, distant manor, rent-free cottage

segment_text: It grew worse as Alice grew up, for he soon saw I was more afraid of her knowing my past than of the police. Whatever he wanted he must have, and whatever it was I gave him without question, land, money, houses, until at last he asked a thing which I could not give.
scene_description: outdoors, English countryside, fertile farmland, distant manor, rent-free cottage

segment_text: He asked for Alice. His son, you see, had grown up, and so had my girl, and as I was known to be in weak health, it seemed a fine stroke to him that his lad should step into the whole property.
scene_description: outdoors, English countryside, fertile farmland, distant manor, rent-free cottage

segment_text: But there I was firm. I would not have his cursed stock mixed with mine; not that I had any dislike to the lad, but his blood was in him, and that was enough.
scene_description: outdoors, English countryside, fertile farmland, distant manor, rent-free cottage

segment_text: I stood firm. McCarthy threatened. I braved him to do his worst. We were to meet at the pool midway between our houses to talk it over.
scene_description: outdoors, English countryside, fertile farmland, distant manor, rent-free cottage

segment_text: “When I went down there I found him talking with his son, so I smoked a cigar and waited behind a tree until he should be alone.
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: But as I listened to his talk all that was black and bitter in me seemed to come uppermost. He was urging his son to marry my daughter with as little regard for what she might think as if she were a slut from off the streets.
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: It drove me mad to think that I and all that I held most dear should be in the power of such a man as this. Could I not snap the bond? I was already a dying and a desperate man.
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: Though clear of mind and fairly strong of limb, I knew that my own fate was sealed. But my memory and my girl! Both could be saved if I could but silence that foul tongue.
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: I did it, Mr. Holmes. I would do it again. Deeply as I have sinned, I have led a life of martyrdom to atone for it.
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: But that my girl should be entangled in the same meshes which held me was more than I could suffer. I struck him down with no more compunction than if he had been some foul and venomous beast.
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: His cry brought back his son; but I had gained the cover of the wood, though I was forced to go back to fetch the cloak which I had dropped in my flight. That is the true story, gentlemen, of all that occurred.”
scene_description: outdoors, reed-lined pool, trampled muddy grass, dense woods, large beech tree

segment_text: “Well, it is not for me to judge you,” said Holmes as the old man signed the statement which had been drawn out. “I pray that we may never be exposed to such a temptation.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “I pray not, sir. And what do you intend to do?” “In view of your health, nothing.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: You are yourself aware that you will soon have to answer for your deed at a higher court than the Assizes. I will keep your confession, and if McCarthy is condemned I shall be forced to use it.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: If not, it shall never be seen by mortal eye; and your secret, whether you be alive or dead, shall be safe with us.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “Farewell, then,” said the old man solemnly. “Your own deathbeds, when they come, will be the easier for the thought of the peace which you have given to mine.”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Tottering and shaking in all his giant frame, he stumbled slowly from the room.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: “God help us!” said Holmes after a long silence. “Why does fate play such tricks with poor, helpless worms?
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: I never hear of such a case as this that I do not think of Baxter’s words, and say, ‘There, but for the grace of God, goes Sherlock Holmes.’”
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: James McCarthy was acquitted at the Assizes on the strength of a number of objections which had been drawn out by Holmes and submitted to the defending counsel.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light

segment_text: Old Turner lived for seven months after our interview, but he is now dead; and there is every prospect that the son and daughter may come to live happily together in ignorance of the black cloud which rests upon their past.
scene_description: indoors, hotel room, victorian decor, variable light
